snippet: Bank of America’s mortgage settlement is said to be deadlocked. | The manager of Harvard’s endowment plans to step down. | A.I.G. has named its next chief executive. | The banking industry is trying to adapt to stricter regulations and low market ...
lead_paragraph: BANK OF AMERICA SETTLEMENT DEADLOCKED  |  Bank of America and the Justice Department have reached an impasse in negotiations over a multibillion-dollar settlement, raising the stakes in an investigation into the bank’s role at the center of the mortgage crisis, DealBook’s Jessica Silver-Greenberg, Ben Protess and Michael Corkery write. The talks stalled on Monday after the bank’s latest offer, at more than $12 billion, was said to be far short of prosecutors’ demands. The Justice Department has sought a settlement worth roughly $17 billion, which would be the largest payout by any bank to date.

headline.main: Morning Agenda: An Impasse in Bank of America Settlement
